meanings.definition: To reduce (a dead body) to ashes by burning.
meanings.sent1: The funeral home cremates deceased individuals to respectfully handle their remains.
meanings.sent2: The family decided to cremate their loved one instead of opting for a traditional burial.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally cremated its toy mouse by leaving it too close to the candle.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat of the sun can almost cremate anything left in its path.
meanings.sent5: The volcanic eruption was so powerful that it seemed to cremate everything in its wake.

meanings.definition: To incinerate (something, especially a dead body).
meanings.sent1: The firefighter had to cremate the pile of leaves to prevent a forest fire.
meanings.sent2: The crematorium was busy as it cremated several bodies each day.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally cremated the dish by leaving it in the oven for too long.
meanings.sent4: The dragon's fiery breath could easily cremate anything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The intense heat of the bonfire seemed to cremate the marshmallows in seconds.

meanings.definition: To perform the act of cremation on a dead body.
meanings.sent1: The funeral director cremates bodies with utmost care and respect for the deceased.
meanings.sent2: The cremator carefully cremated each body according to the family's wishes.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved cremating a fake body on stage, much to the audience's amazement.
meanings.sent4: The wildfire seemed to cremate the entire forest, leaving only ashes behind.
meanings.sent5: The intense heat of the furnace can quickly cremate a body, leaving only ashes as a result.
